commit_message:
Fix neutron_network for --router:external setting

Neutron can't be called with --router:external=True as that
will cause "ignored explicit argument u'True'" error.

Change-Id: I49a033fd2821100283e217225896fc93a927edd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/48/159548/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if @resource[:router_external] == 'False' network_opts << '--router:external=False' else network_opts << '--router:external' if value == 'False' auth_neutron('net-update', "--router:external=#{value}", name) else auth_neutron('net-update', "--router:external", name) end

subject: Corrects "ip link set" command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 09:54:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/32186652c6d511c8d31d24bada97a69ce45e523c', 'message': '  There is a minor problem in provider/neutron_l3_ovs_bridge/neutron.rb that only occurs under one condition.

    It executed the command

     ip link set @resource[:name] up

    This command fails when the resource name is br with the following error:

    ip link set br up

    "up" is invalid lladdr.

    To correct this error execute with ip link set dev @resource[:name] up:

    from ip link help:

    ip link set { dev DEVICE | group DEVGROUP } [ { up | down }

Change-Id: I35b5ee79b05c01d4261935a55c8b3b86a7c8d8b2
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-18 14:56:52.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/neutron_l3_ovs_bridge/neutron.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/45e05dd4b827bc6b442b35f82492f631168556ee', 'message': 'Corrects "ip link set" command

neutron_l3_ovs_bridge/neutron.rb executes the command
ip link set @resource[:name] up

This command fails when the resource name is br with the following error:
ip link set br up
"up" is invalid lladdr.

To correct this error execute with ip link set dev @resource[:name] up:

from ip link help:
ip link set { dev DEVICE | group DEVGROUP } [ { up | down }

Change-Id: I35b5ee79b05c01d4261935a55c8b3b86a7c8d8b2
'}]
commit_message:
Corrects "ip link set" command

neutron_l3_ovs_bridge/neutron.rb executes the command
ip link set @resource[:name] up

This command fails when the resource name is br with the following error:
ip link set br up
"up" is invalid lladdr.

To correct this error execute with ip link set dev @resource[:name] up:

from ip link help:
ip link set { dev DEVICE | group DEVGROUP } [ { up | down }

Change-Id: I35b5ee79b05c01d4261935a55c8b3b86a7c8d8b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/32/155232/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ip('link', 'set', 'dev', @resource[:name], 'up')

commit_message:
Add second job for lbaasv1 API

Necessary to remove lbaas tests from tempest, as requested by QA team.
Unless we have a good way to reconfigure and restart neutron in the middle
of a devstack run, in which case we could recycle the node currently
being used for v2 api tests.

Also pull lbaasv2 api tests from the gate, since it is currently non-voting.

Change-Id: I12fca506d5d763366cfd55b7b2986351dea0e613

commit_message:
Cleanup minor rubocop offenses

Cleaned up all the minor rubocop issues, the ones left relate to
complex logic and what I think is a bug in rubocop for nested
vs compact modules/class definitions.

commit_message:
Update the deprecated group/name to Kilo release

For Kilo release, there are many deprecated group/name in conf files of openstack,
so we need to change the deprecated group/name to new group/name.

blueprint conf-section-update-for-kilo
Closes-bug: #1436170

Change-Id: If3f1df23fc64555a26e9d467c8e4f189a5e9442e

commit_message:
Switch to using test -n

Using the construct of x$var != x is unnecessary, and has been
unnecessary for quite some time. We trust our shell, so switch to
using test -n.

Change-Id: I8eea943e5b641ba3d8781212877da7ddec167a6c

commit_message:
Don't repeat the commit message

When we edit the commit message for sending the patch for updating
translations, we repeat the entire text of the commit message,
rather than using the existing variable (which is fine, because the
shell will expand the variable before assigning it).

Change-Id: I2840935d2174b1931de0cb782e52cfed4c049312

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-20 21:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_update.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/f8253a6670f0405a7d1826b93a0006fda7d02fd4', 'message': "Don't use set +e to check the return value

In propose_update, we were pushing the shell's set -e functionality
out of the way, so we could use a if block to check the return value.
We only care if the command exits non-zero, so we can do it in an if
directly.

Change-Id: I196751e79aee24e96a854fec4a51b4756c96047f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use set +e to check the return value

In propose_update, we were pushing the shell's set -e functionality
out of the way, so we could use a if block to check the return value.
We only care if the command exits non-zero, so we can do it in an if
directly.

Change-Id: I196751e79aee24e96a854fec4a51b4756c96047f

Change-Id: Ib69e2e421b216d6087ad47c198067667db89cc33

'}]
commit_message:
Correct docs on format for neutron::policy data

Correct the format of the $policies parameter to neutron::policy.
That parameter is passed directly to create_resources, so it needs
to be in a format acceptable to that.

Just updating docs here as anyone already using the policy classes
are likely not using the (incorrectly) documented format, anyway.

Change-Id: Ib69e2e421b216d6087ad47c198067667db89cc33
Closes-bug: 1409897

commit_message:
Move git config to a common function/file

There are a number of calls to git config in the slave scripts are
all the same, and we should use a shell function to not repeat
ourselves.

Change-Id: Ib2fa3d5ca12d5d08e2d21a734fea13aa9848b19e

commit_message:
Raise puppet error, if N-API anavail

W/o this change, empty lists could be returned
and broke puppet apply execution when Neutron
(or Keystone) API is anavail.

The solution is to raise Puppet error, if
returned lists are empty

Closes-bug: #1384101

Change-Id: I10b6592f709603043e97304366c54e53703939ea
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

Update Compute Chapter - Introduction

Updated the intro section with a vague outline of what I plan
to cover in the next few merges. Added <filename> tags and
cut up sentence with "and...and...and" in it.

Change-Id: I30cd87fdd02efca69027656ba87f6e087d490827
Partial-Bug: 1412975
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/63/186563/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para> The OpenStack Compute service (nova) is one of the more complex OpenStack services. It runs in many locations throughout the cloud and interacts with a variety of internal services. There are a variety of configuration options when using the OpenStack Compute service, and these can be deployment-specific. In this chapter we will call out general best practice around Compute security as well as specific known configurations that can lead to security issues. In general, the nova.conf file and the <filename>/var/lib/nova</filename> locations should be secure, and things like centralized logging, the policy.json file, and a mandatory access control framework should be implemented. Additionally, there are environmental considerations to keep in mind, depending on what functionality is desired for your cloud. </para>
deleted_lines: <para>The Compute service (nova) is one of the more complex OpenStack services. It runs in many locations throughout the cloud and interacts with a variety of internal services. For this reason, most of our recommendations regarding best practices for Compute service configuration are distributed throughout this book. We provide specific details in the sections on Management, API Endpoints, Messaging, and Database.</para>

commit_message:
Updated repo server deps

This updates the deps that need to be on the repo server to ensure
that all of the python sources are built correctly. The additional
packages are in response to an upstream package dep
`python-qpid-proton` which is now requiring these items.

Change-Id: I6d6f70734fd46c4055f49fdf25035d2b4b212414

commit_message:
Ignore last-translator for translation update trigger

Do not import a file if the Last-Translator line has changed (together
with other ignored lines).

This will ignore imports like
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/183771/1/doc/glossary/locale/ja.po

If there are other changes, including real translations, the file will
get imported as usual.

Change-Id: I6f56f64c107e4f93b92460612e656b91341a8338

commit_message:
Add futurist adoption project changes

This was recently approved to be an oslo subproject:

- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179890/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182803/

Other items at:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.utils/+spec/adopt-futurist

This adds hopefully all of the needed config adjustments
to make this import correctly so that it can be worked
on and improved (from its initial repo where it was
extracted from).

Change-Id: I39336315a7327b638a0feb6d650fa2cc40260ec5

commit_message:
Fix Debian link on landing page

The link on the landing page pointed to a
Debian glance image. Since that entry was
added to the landing page, the associated
Debian entry in the glance section was updated
to be more specific (which broke the link
on the landing page.

This commit fixes that link on the landing
page.

Change-Id: Ief25f2d9ad80c4fe4fb880aa4e2ceff3daf02abd

commit_message:
Add InfluxDB

Gnocchi will get a new storage driver: InfluxDB

This is python module to use the InfluxDB API.

gnocchi driver: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/165407/

The library is released in MIT License.

The library is released ~ 2 times by month.
https://github.com/influxdb/influxdb-python/releases

The source code is automatically tested by the travis-CI.
https://travis-ci.org/influxdb/influxdb-python

And the code is well covered.
https://coveralls.io/r/influxdb/influxdb-python

The documentation is autogenerated:
https://influxdb-python.readthedocs.org/en/latest/

The library is python3 compatible.

This is already packaged in ubuntu vivied and debian jessie (but outdated)
Fedora have packages for the server, and the python binding
will arrived very soon with the 2.2.0 version.

Also, upstream maintains its own packages for all
distributions, too.

This version have been choosen because of recently bug fixed
for gnocchi.

Change-Id: Ifa1da4e3c7b1372c9a2aeb021542284e5a139dcf

specified in the test-requirement.txt file,
which causes failure in gate-python-cinderclient-pep8.

This patch bumps the pbr version in test-requirement.txt
to make it consistent with requirements repository,
and adds some fixups to avoid some new hacking rules.

Change-Id: I7de6e04e30a475ec1c26224461faf0c708178a40
Closes-Bug: #1460774
'}]
commit_message:
Bump hacking to >=0.10.0,<0.11 to fix failure of gate pep8

pbr 1.0.1 released in 2015-05-19 requires the newer
hacking module >=0.10.0,<0.11 than the versions
specified in the test-requirement.txt file,
which causes failure in gate-python-cinderclient-pep8.

This patch bumps the pbr version in test-requirement.txt
to make it consistent with requirements repository,
and adds some fixups to avoid some new hacking rules.

Change-Id: I7de6e04e30a475ec1c26224461faf0c708178a40
Closes-Bug: #1460774

commit_message:
Use Cirros for CI testing

Utilizing Cirros for the guest operating system when performing a
basic test saves a significant amount of time and resources for the
test as it prevents the creation of a disk image.

Additionally, the native support for configuration drives allows
the amount of time we're waiting on the guest OS to be greatly
reduced.

Change-Id: I5a4c497d3502c975db060d3ee08ea2056399a062
Closes-Bug: #1460052

commit_message:
Deprecated js-test build.

StoryBoard and Merlin now use npm-run to handle their tests.
Vinz has no code, and therefore doesn't need these builds.

commit_message:
Don't ignore template argument in get_injected_network_template

Use previously detected template file (in template variable)
instead of CONF.injected_network_template.

Existing detection logic is fine:
* If template argument is defined, it is used.
* If template argument is None, CONF.injected_network_template is used.

Change-Id: I77385bfb2d79be34aed476ed4840fe03c59ed7df
Closes-bug: #1441892

commit_message:
Remove outdated TODO comment

A TODO comment added by Brian Waldon in
\nova\api\openstack\compute\contrib\admin_actions.py
about adding prefix 'os-' before all admin actions
can be considered as outdated. Removing it to avoid
misunderstanding.

Change-Id: I8ed995373f713d6cf8080d7c0bb6808c3ac9dd86
Closes-Bug:1458285

commit_message:
Define MidoNet v2 devstack-gate jobs

MidoNet will change its architecture soon (codename MidoNet v2), and
Neutron plugin must support both architectures for a couple of OpenStack
releases.

This patch defines a new non-voting jenkins job for devstack gate which
deploys a MidoNet v2 and runs tempest tests. A boolen USE_CLUSTER
environment variable is needed to do so.

commit_message:
create temporary variable for the upgrade process

Upgrades stalled when installing pip packages with an external loadbalancer.
The temporary variable will allow pip to connect directly to the local pip
repo server instead of through the loadbalancer.  The file this variable goes
in is named to be removed.

Closes-Bug: 1460700
Change-Id: I1b257a77b5814f3024c7d7885bf3b807eeb2526b
(cherry picked from commit 1b66cf69006cca5af4a42df20cef2edd6c5a87a3)

Save last_check_data before return on nagios check

The finally ensures the check time is saved even for an unknown status

Change-Id: Ic3c8bcbe1aa80be431dbed41190ad2b404677f99

commit_message:
Handle proxies through environment variables

When running os-ansible-deployment on a cluster siting behind a proxy,
users may need to set up special variables for proxies so that pip, and
the services all work as expected.

Closes-bug: 1452456
Change-Id: I2a397abad6557a48bc737dcd9cca787fc5afa728
(cherry picked from commit ed7f78ea5689769b3a5e1db444f4c16f3cc06060)

added_lines: {% if global_environment_variables is defined %} {%- for name, value in global_environment_variables.items() %} {% if value %} if ! grep '{{ name }}={{ value }}' /etc/environment; echo '{{ name }}={{ value }}' | tee -a /etc/environment fi {% endif %} {%- endfor %} {% endif %}

commit_message:
create temporary variable for the upgrade process

Upgrades stalled when installing pip packages with an external loadbalancer.
The temporary variable will allow pip to connect directly to the local pip
repo server instead of through the loadbalancer.  The file this variable goes
in is named to be removed.

Closes-Bug: 1460700
Change-Id: I1b257a77b5814f3024c7d7885bf3b807eeb2526b

commit_message:
Template for testing document

Change-Id: I17175eca9781966e255bd1a0e843a1fc2778e046
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/82/163882/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================================== Example Test Plan For: [ The title of your Spec goes here ] =========================================================== [modify the following line to link to the blueprint for this feature] `bp example <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/example>`_ [Information inside square brackets is provided as instructions to the author. It should be removed before publishing the test plan. Every testplan should be linked to a blueprint, which should, in turn link to a specificatiomn (spec). Information in the spec should not be reproduced here. Instead, this document will focus on testing aspects of the feature defined by the specification. These are expected to be living documents. A test plan, once written, will be augmented as more people contribute to testing the feature. There is no requirement that this document be considered `complete` before being accepted into the spec repository.] Scope ===== [This subsection should contain the scope of the test plan. This section should let the reader know that the test plan is going to be used to describe the testing strategy for the feature testing but will not contain the actual implementation details for the testing process. This section should list the aspect/s of the feature being tested as part of this feature testing. This section should also document any testing that is out of scope for this plan. This section should also inform the reader that the tracking of the actual implementation of the plan is not in the scope of this document. Other objectives of the test plan can also be listed here. Definitions Test Plan: A document (this document) that describes the scope, tools, environment, high level test scenarios, and testing effort carried out throughout the software development lifecycle. Test Scenario: Test scenario is a high level objective of a test derived from a use case or from the requirements. It is Whats being verified. Test Case: Test case is derived from the test scenario with a set of actions and expected results to verify that the system operates as designed and meets the defined requirements. It is How it is verified.] Test Environment Requirements ============================= [This section should give the reader a complete idea of the lab and infrastructure requirements from a testing point of view  hardware, software, tools, and configurations  for all types of planned testing. The requirements specified can be high level. The use of diagrams to depict specific configurations is encouraged. Typically, testing will be performed using devstack based deployments first. Any specific alterations or configuration options for devstack should be nted here. If testing a feature requires changes to devstack, they should be enumerated here, but also submitted as specs for changes to devstack. ] Software Requirements ===================== [ If specific version of third party software is required to test a feature it should be noted here.] Software Description Version required Associated Commands & Tools =========================== [This subsection should give a listing of the associated commands that have been added to the product as part of the feature under development. This subsection should also provide a reference to or a description of the usage and syntax on any of the external test tools or debug tools & their description that will be used while testing the feature. If there are any hidden commands for debug mode first ask the developer of the feature whether these can be listed here, as this document is made available to reviewers outside of engineering.] Test Strategy ============= [This section should contain a listing of all the testing components (functional, regression, functional limits, data integrity, GUI, API, CLI or application interoperability) required to qualify the feature under consideration. It is highly recommended that one test plan be created and maintained for each feature. Test developers from different components integrates into a feature should collaborate on the plan under the direction of the Overall Feature Test Lead. If a certain type of testing is determined to be not applicable, the rationale for not performing that testing should be explained here. This section should also be updated to include how any test scenarios or test scripts developed as part of unit testing. It should also specify # of test covered by regression testing i.e. legacy tests coming from previous releases. In addition, any enhancement test scenarios should also be appended in this area rather than creating a new test plan. The goal of this section is so that anyone who is not familiar with the testing could read the document and be able to understand how we plan to test a particular feature and assess what is the coverage of the testing ] Unit Testing ------------ [ Unit tests are considered part of the coding process. They are stored in the Keystojn source code repository, and are part of the code review process. This section should be kept short, and only touch on any non-obvious aspects of unit tests.] Acceptance Testing ------------------ [This section should contain sanity test approach for the feature. Include high level scenarios here.] Regression Testing ------------------ [This section should document new functionality regression test coverage required to ensure that he feature does not introduce regressions. While it is correct to call out any existing tests, it is not required or useful to oput an exhaustive list in this section.] Functional Testing ------------------ [This subsection should be the heart of the document. Describe the test scenarios and objective of the test cases developed for testing the functional component of the feature as well as any specific scenarios to be incorporated from sanity test plan. Based on these scenarios test engineer will develop detailed test cases in the test management tool. Keystone functional test are also added to the Keystone test repository, under keystone/tests/functional. Provide the name for the test case for this feature here. If a feature is complex enough to require its own sub directroy, name that sub directory here. OR complete the sentence below and leave as text for this section:] No functional testing is required for this feature because.... [Descriptive Example of high level test scenarios] CIFSWindowsClient Test Scenario: Test file operations on windows with CIFS access on content file/s from a client with Cygwin activated. Test case objectives: On CIFS access from a windows client, File operations on a CIFS share : Read, Write, Append, Delete Change permissions of a file from CIFS mount and verify fuse, nfs mount, and the backend File operations on a CIFS share as a non-admin user : Read, Write, Append, Delete with MS-Excel file operations on a CIFS share for one and several files, for one and several file systems with various file sizes, including very big file whose signature requires several network exchanges to be read. 3.5 Limits Testing [This subsection should be used to describe the test scenarios and test case objectives for limits testing associated with the feature. Put the location to the actual test cases from the test management tool here. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] There are no specified limits which require testing [Descriptive Example of high level test scenario] CIFSFileOperationsLimit Test Scenario: Test case objectives: check file operations as expected for small files (smaller than 64KB) symbolic links files under /.etc API Testing ----------- [This subsection should be used to describe the test scenarios for API testing associated with the feature. Put the location to the actual test cases from test management system here. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] There are no external APIs which require testing System Management Testing ------------------------- [This section should be used to describe the tests required to manage the system. For Keystone, this is restricted to changes to the `keystone-manage` cli, or edits to the configuration files. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] GUI Testing ----------- [This subsection should be used to describe the test scenarios for Horizon testing associated with the feature. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] There are no GUI management interfaces supported for this feature. CLI Testing ----------- [This subsection should be used to describe the test scenarios for testing the fetuare from the Openstack CLI. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] There are no CLI management interfaces supported for this feature. Usability Evaluation -------------------- [The purpose of a usability evaluation is to predict the expected performance of the actual customer using the product/feature. The goal is to detect any serious ease-of-use problems prior to the release of the product and to evaluate the potential for errors and difficulties. A usability assessment for a feature usually involves an evaluation of various ways in which a user interacts with a feature, including applications interoperability, software function, menus and navigation/layout, and error and status messages and typically will be conducted by the UXD while the functional spec is under development. This section should identify any specific usability concerns associated with this feature resulting from the UXD assessment and how they will be evaluated during the test cycle. OR leave this sentence in as text for this section.] No usability evaluation is planned for this feature. Performance Testing ------------------- [This section should be used to describe the scenarios required to test performance specific to the feature. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] No performance testing is planned for this feature. Scalability Testing ------------------- [This section should be used to describe the scenarios required to ensure scalability of this feature. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] No scalability testing is planned for this feature. Impacted Features & Tests ========================= [This section will list all the features that may be impacted by this feature here. The functional specification should contain this information. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] This feature does not impact any other product capabilities. Impacted Feature Tests ---------------------- [This subsection should describe the test scenarios to be developed or to be modified, if any, for the impacted feature. Subsections may be created if there is more than one impacted feature. If the test scenarios have been included in the Test Plan for the impacted feature then a hyperlink to the impacted feature test plan should be added here. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] None Impacted Feature Regression Tests --------------------------------- [This subsection should describe the test suites that need to be run to ensure that the impacted feature has not been affected in a negative manner. Subsections may be created if there is more than one impacted feature. A hyperlink to the impacted feature test plan should be added here. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] None Impact to non-functional areas [This subsection should describe the test approach to be taken to ensure that the feature and the system has not been affected in a negative manner for reliability, scalability, security, and interoperability (with other features or products). OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] There is no impact to non-functional areas of the system. Defect Tracking =============== [Provide information (in term of fields or descriptive data) that will be useful to persons filing defects against this feature.] [ Example: Feature Name, any log files that are specific to the features, how to identify this features in system logs] Assumptions =========== [This section should contain a list of all the assumptions made while writing this test plan. In particular this section should call out any assumptions made about resource availability (people and/or hardware) as well as dependencies on project artifacts or development deliverables as they affect testers ability to deliver artifacts stated in section 6 of this plan, e.g., the availability of incremental functionality for early test or availability of approved design documents or clearly defined user stories/requirements and walkthru of the functionality provided by product management and architects. OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] No explicit assumptions are made in writing this test plan. Issues ====== [This section should contain a list of all the issues that may be faced during the implementation of this test plan, the person responsible for resolving the issue and a date by when the issue is expected to be resolved. You can also put things such as questions to be answered regarding the feature or testing of the feature, things you are unclear about when writing the test plan, or issues raised during the test plan review. This section should not be used to report issues found during the actual implementation and execution of the plan, i.e., defects. You are responsible for driving these issues to closure before build hand-off and for updating the plan to include a description and date of the resolution Date Issue Resolution Owner Date Resolved 01/20/14 We still need to determine how to report test results when the same test suite is executed on multiple environments. John Blah 01/20/14 We also need more information from Product Management on performance expectations of this feature in distributed environment Peter Blah 01/20/14 Architects need to provide more information on how this feature integrates with feature B. Perter Blah OR leave the sentence below as text for this section:] No issues are currently identified for the implementation of this test plan

commit_message:
Support custom kernel cmdline args for deploy iso

This commit adds support for providing custom kernel
cmdline args while building deploy ISO.  This is useful
for adding kernel cmdline like 'console=ttyS1' in
environment (assuming all bare metals have been configured
to output to COM2 in BIOS).

Closes-Bug: 1451634
Change-Id: I20b04d9d104cfe46df0439c3f567a721a27e186a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/92/179992/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EMITTED_KERNEL_CMDLINE_ARGS="boot_method=vmedia $DIB_DEPLOY_ISO_KERNEL_CMDLINE_ARGS" EMITTED_KERNEL_CMDLINE_ARGS="boot_method=vmedia $DIB_DEPLOY_ISO_KERNEL_CMDLINE_ARGS"

commit_message:
Add $notification_driver parameter to notify::rabbitmq

It makes possible to control the value of notification_driver setting and defaults
to 'messaging' to maintain backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I3f2c29adbfb605ef288962f72ba81c11811cb357
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/42/161242/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ceilometer = false, if $ceilometer { glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/notification_driver': value => 'messaging' } } else { glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/notification_driver': ensure => absent } } glance_api_config {

commit_message:
Suppress false alarms from bandit

nova/cmd/manage.py::215 - We are running a script as designed so exec is ok
nova/utils.py::1131 - We are using md5 just for hashing
nova/virt/xenapi/client/session.py::213 - eval/pickle for plugins
nova/virt/xenapi/client/session.py::291 - eval/pickle for plugins
nova/virt/xenapi/fake.py::661 - eval/pickle for plugins
nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py::1961 - url scheme is loaded from nova configuration
                                     so we are ok.

Closes-Bug: #1460061
Depends-On: I3026b81317f0a6322acfc94784899a7453af586f
Change-Id: I168d34ce53023d5c0d57b5cf0c2ca8c993017cdd

Without the correct --config-file parameter the glance-manage db_sync
command does not sync the correct database. The default without any
configuration is to use an SQLite Database at /var/lib/glance/glancedb.
This is most probably not what's intended.

Change-Id: I61f4e47ad082b48ee83b17df70e9856f640083b1
"}]
commit_message:
Command parameter to sync the correct Database

Without the correct --config-file parameter the glance-manage db_sync
command does not sync the correct database. The default without any
configuration is to use an SQLite Database at /var/lib/glance/glancedb.
This is most probably not what's intended.

Change-Id: I61f4e47ad082b48ee83b17df70e9856f640083b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/77/158277/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $db_sync_command = 'glance-manage --config-file=/etc/glance/glance-registry.conf db_sync' $db_sync_command = 'glance-manage --config-file=/etc/glance/glance-registry.conf db_sync'

commit_message:
Modifying ACL data in response to match request payload format.

As mentioned in ACL docs comments, the expectation is to have exact same data
structure in response as provided in ACL creation/update request by client.
So converting acl data in response to match with request payload format.

Also addressing another bug # 1450845.

Closes-bug: #1450845

Change-Id: I3783f692efdcccedf193249d8e9f3ec4105fc9a4

commit_message:
Fix cells capacity calculation for n:1 virt drivers

The capacity calculation in cells assumes a 1:1 mapping for
compute_hosts:nova-compute. Fix this calculation to allow for
drivers that have an n:1 mapping.

Co-Authored-By: John Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: 1385468
Change-Id: If361b8bedd81147120581f7f9fe43b8b3f4325e5

deleted_lines: compute_hosts = {} compute_hosts[host] = { 'free_ram_mb': compute['free_ram_mb'], 'free_disk_mb': compute['free_disk_gb'] * 1024, 'total_ram_mb': compute['memory_mb'], 'total_disk_mb': compute['local_gb'] * 1024}

commit_message:
VMware: Fix missing target resource pool

The volume is cloned while creating it from another volume, snapshot
or image. Currently, the target resource pool is unset while calling
vCenter CloneVM_Task API.

So when a clone happens across clusters in a vCenter clone fails.
This patch fixes the problem by setting the target resource pool
(returned by datastore selection logic) while invoking clone.

Closes-Bug: #1416456

Change-Id: Ib1023efe6fd19d604af89f7e4b4f67640d778d39
(cherry picked from commit 0df929e60c9053240b792dea7ed7e2c10de69fc1)

commit_message:
Support identity_uri in provider

After https://review.openstack.org/152321 was merged, it was no
longer guaranteed that some now deprecated settings like auth_host
and auth_protocol would be present in glance-api.conf. This breaks
the Glance provider, which expects them to be present.

This patch adds support for identity_uri in provider, while
keeping backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Ie8a2e45a4afea4828e02af36e64d65e7d4b7557e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/45/160845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove stable cross-test jobs from cliff

Remove the jobs that run the unit tests of cliff against stable OSC and
neutronclient. We rely on the dsvm jobs to run integration tests of
cliff changes, using both OSC and neutronclient for stable branches.

Configure the jobs that run the unit tests of cliff against stable OSC
and neutronclient to only run when patches are submitted to master.

Change-Id: I42c50ea8fd4b185dd1e745d3bdb6695814840e24

commit_message:
Correct docs on format for glance::policy data

Correct the format of the $policies parameter to glance::policy.
That parameter is passed directly to create_resources, so it needs
to be in a format acceptable to that.

Just updating docs here as anyone already using the policy classes
are likely not using the (incorrectly) documented format, anyway.

Change-Id: I80f1f832db124eef3bfd75907e4a2dcb5a5effca
Closes-bug: 1409897

commit_message:
add option to use dd for swapfile creation

fallocate is faster than using dd to create a thick swapfile with
zeros, but it is not supported on all filesystems (specifically ext3).

This commit adds a fallback to using dd if fallocate fails

Closes-Bug: #1458841

Change-Id: Ie4adf625d85f84a0d89a108ef0438622ab763b9d
(cherry picked from commit ccb16763234a13fc204b91943e3d0c197545f2e9)

commit_message:
Correctly munge glance_image is_public property

glance expects True/False values whereas this type uses Yes/No.

Without this patch, puppet would return the following message with an
existing glance image with is_public attribute already set to 'True'.

puppet-agent[18190]: (/Stage[main]/Site::Controller/Glance_image[raring-server-cloudimg-amd64]/is_public) is_public changed 'True' to 'Yes'

Change-Id: I532e08e6815a8b03f5eb6a9495d886b9855762c8

commit_message:
Fixing keystone v3 version use for horizon

The setting for overriding Horizon's OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS is not
the correct format. The version should be a number, not a string.

so should be 3, not "v3".

Change-Id: I193d21514b196336796eac067417dc2aaec56433
Closes-Bug: #1460190

commit_message:
Add support for Docker image format

The 'Docker' format is added to the default list of supported
formats so it can be selected from the list of formats when creating
or updating an image. When the docker format is selected, the
disk_format and container_format properties are set appropriately.
This also includes changes to the Format column and filter for the
Images table to handle this type.

Closes-Bug: #1455179
Change-Id: Ie705c86d47c0b6035373b9311454748122185988

commit_message:
Add --wait to server delete

This allows the server delete command to wait for the server to be
deleted (obviously).

The wait method is the same model that Tempest uses, i.e. wait for a 404
on server GET (successful deletion), fail if the server went to ERROR
status, or fail if a timeout is reached.  The default timeout of 300
seconds is also what Tempest uses.

Closes-Bug: #1460112

Change-Id: I0e66c400903e82832944d1cad61e7eb30177c3e8

commit_message:
Update the Upstream OpenStack Configuration guide for NFS backup

In kilo, we added NFS backup service for cinder alongside swift, ceph,
and tsm.

This commit updates the configuration guide with information on how to
configure cinder.conf to use the NFS backup service.

Change-Id: I6de56439c90fbe1e549f42314b8c920fd5a6b6f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/17/182817/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <section xml:id="nfs-backup-driver" xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0"> <title>NFS backup driver</title> <para>The backup driver for the NFS back end performs a volume backup to an NFS exported backup repository.</para> <para>To enable the NFS backup driver, include the following option in the <filename>cinder.conf</filename> file:</para> <programlisting>backup_driver = cinder.backup.drivers.nfs</programlisting> <para>The following configuration options are available for the NFS back-end backup driver.</para> <!-- Add when the table is generated <xi:include href="../../../common/tables/cinder-backups_nfs.xml"/> --> <para>This example shows the default options for the NFS back-end backup driver.</para> <programlisting>backup_share = <None> backup_mount_options = <None> backup_file_size = 1999994880 backup_sha_block_size_bytes = 32768 backup_compression_algorithm = zlib backup_enable_progress_timer = True backup_mount_point_base = $state_path/backup_mount</programlisting> </section>

commit_message:
Fix get_instance_by_id, catch NotFound appopriately

novaclient will raise a NotFound exception here instead of returning None,
which the rest of the RUG assumes.

Change-Id: I6812bd01bb4a56433bc1c408040470d3711a0005
Closes-bug: #1459445
(cherry picked from commit ceaf3ce53c29c20dea02fba1b9dcead437991d0c)

commit_message: Instance overview renders erroneous markup Under Instance Detail | Overview | Meta | Key Name an unclosed is rendered for an instance launched without an associated key pair. This seems to be reproducible using Django 1.6.1 in local devstack. The issue seems to be that Django's implementation of the add filter has an issue concatenating a string and a function to localize text. Since that fails and returns an empty string which subsequently is added to the closing tag, the closing tag is the only thing that is displayed. This fix saves the localized value to a variable which is then used in the add filter. Closes-Bug: #1423797 Change-Id: I4452ca4a902bbaf19ae5b2bd9bcbe2900069ac3b

commit_message:
NetApp FC driver shims missing manage/unmanage

The NetApp FC drivers' passthrough shim layers are missing the
manage/unmanage methods, causing the manage/unmanage functions
to fail.  The necessary functionality is already present in
the underlying library layer, so the trivial fix is to add the
functions to the passthrough layers. This patch also adds a
unit test to ensure the four block storage driver interfaces
remain in sync.

Change-Id: I0fa7e16b23e5148f82a8b51bf4380f4384c35759
Closes-Bug: #1444517

commit_message:
Swift client wrapper

We currently upload logs and images to swift in two ways.
- Using the python swift client directly to upload logs
- Using a stand alone python script which is called from our bash
  scripts to upload images.

We need to consolidate these two so we have a common place for our
swift integration code which supports the following

- Upload and download objects.
- Check object size to make sure we are under the 5GB swift
  constraint.
- Retry logic
- Delete objects

I'm also changing the swift client code to always create a
non cached client. This is required for our upload\download
retry mechanism to work properly.

Change-Id: I9993d0b74197a517920468b7fd07e29bbc305ed0
Closes-bug: 1456807

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-22 16:23:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/solum/commit/3f4841aea9ebe6d9faf09dfadeed11da8442b6e8', 'message': "Fixing concurrency bug in heat deployer

Problem:
We want to ensure that only one assembly is in a READY state
for an app. This is to ensure that Solum does not keep around
more heat stacks than are necessary. If there are more than one
assemblies then there are that many number of heat stacks,
which we want to avoid.

So the solution that we came up with is to delete other
READY assemblies when a new assembly has become READY.

However, this solution as is currently implemented
has concurrency issues in the situation when there are multiple
deployers in the system. In our testing we have seen both of
the following:
(a) when two assembly create are triggered in quick succession both
    are deleted
(b) when two assembly creates are triggered in quick succession
    none is deleted

This patch fixes the concurrency issue to ensure that both the
above situations don't arise.

The fix for (a) is to use the 'created_at' timestamp when deleting
assemblies. The idea is to delete all the READY assemblies which
have created_at timestamp which is smaller than the newly created
assemblies' timestamp. The reason this is correct is because there
will be only one READY assembly which will have the highest created_at
timestamp (because we are using a single database). So this assembly
will end up deleting other assemblies which are READY and have a
smaller created_at timestamp.

The fix for (b) is to perform the database writes to update an
assembly's status in a synchronous manner in the deployer itself.
Current code performs this update in an asynchronous manner via the
conductor. In a multiple deployer scenario this asynchronicity causes
race conditions which leads to situations like (b).

Closes-Bug: #1457200
Change-Id: I3482399fb08ebe19870f6dae69e2edc2a0c07685

commit_message:
Fixing concurrency bug in heat deployer

Problem:
We want to ensure that only one assembly is in a READY state
for an app. This is to ensure that Solum does not keep around
more heat stacks than are necessary. If there are more than one
assemblies then there are that many number of heat stacks,
which we want to avoid.

So the solution that we came up with is to delete other
READY assemblies when a new assembly has become READY.

However, this solution as is currently implemented
has concurrency issues in the situation when there are multiple
deployers in the system. In our testing we have seen both of
the following:
(a) when two assembly create are triggered in quick succession both
    are deleted
(b) when two assembly creates are triggered in quick succession
    none is deleted

This patch fixes the concurrency issue to ensure that both the
above situations don't arise.

The fix for (a) is to use the 'created_at' timestamp when deleting
assemblies. The idea is to delete all the READY assemblies which
have created_at timestamp which is smaller than the newly created
assemblies' timestamp. The reason this is correct is because there
will be only one READY assembly which will have the highest created_at
timestamp (because we are using a single database). So this assembly
will end up deleting other assemblies which are READY and have a
smaller (more recent) created_at timestamp.

The fix for (b) is to perform the database writes to update an
assembly's status in a synchronous manner in the deployer itself.
Current code performs this update in an asynchronous manner via the
conductor. In a multiple deployer scenario this asynchronicity causes
race conditions which leads to situations like (b).

Closes-Bug: #1457200
Change-Id: I3482399fb08ebe19870f6dae69e2edc2a0c07685
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/95/184895/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix date pickers in metering modal
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-30 16:11:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/507debf43279f1574cea685d548a899f44f1f427', 'message': 'Fix date pickers in metering modal

The metering forms were using the date picker functionality from the
d3 line chart library, this used to work when it was loaded as a whole
page as the d3 libary would run intending to setup any d3 graphs however
now it is being loaded as a modal the elements that would be affected by
the d3 code do not exist at page load time.

In order to get the date picker events to be added to the elements on
the form when the modal loads, the JS in the forms template has been
extended in this patch to support adding those events.

This patch also changes the data attributes on the form elements so that
they do not conflict with any d3 line chart elements.

Change-Id: I4e239daa03b2f54e434254bac48ba0cceb037b5d
Closes-Bug: 1427756

commit_message:
Fix date pickers in metering modal

The metering forms were using the date picker functionality from the
d3 line chart library, this used to work when it was loaded as a whole
page as the d3 libary would run intending to setup any d3 graphs however
now it is being loaded as a modal the elements that would be affected by
the d3 code do not exist at page load time.

In order to get the date picker events to be added to the elements on
the form when the modal loads, the JS in the forms template has been
extended in this patch to support adding those events.

This patch also changes the data attributes on the form elements so that
they do not conflict with any d3 line chart elements.

Alongside the javascript this patch fixes bug to do with parsing the
dates in metering utils and adds UTs to prevent regression.

Change-Id: I4e239daa03b2f54e434254bac48ba0cceb037b5d
Closes-Bug: 1427756
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/85/168985/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: setup_datepickers(); setup_datepickers(); }); } function setup_datepickers() { show_hide_datepickers(); $('input[date_picker="True"]').each(function () { var el = $(this); el.datepicker({ format: 'yyyy-mm-dd', setDate: new Date(), showButtonPanel: true });

commit_message:
Verbose waiting for status in neutron FWaaS

In case that neutron doesn't reach desired status, exception is raised.
Curently there is missing more info about current status, that is not
matching.

Change-Id: I3aaeee8615550fdd0a14c57a5475af94f765641b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/75/185575/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: m = ("Timed out waiting for firewall %s to reach %s state(s)" % (fw_id, target_states))

commit_message:
Fix server creation n test_large_ops

The test_large_ops test creates multiple servers directly via
servers_client instead of the manager (which doesn't handle multi
server creation too well). However it failed to pass proper network
configuration to servers_client.

Change-Id: I65414880b41473690bf5e9edae9fd273409acf5d

commit_message:
Log info for Fernet tokens over 255 chars

Fernet tokens were designed to be short and maintain some of the usability of
UUID-like tokens by being copy-pastable. Depending on the deployment
configuration, we could still generate tokens that are over 255 characters. If
this is the case, we should log some information.

Change-Id: I3aa52f7e09c4cf717ddd28d14ee36b80f53b012b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/96/186396/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if len(token) > 255: LOG.warning(_LW('Fernet token created exceeding 255 characters in ' 'length: %s'), token)

subject: Set gw external net to empty for multi-provider networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-23 21:32:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/d219ad4259ad3cb18f71378d16e54d470c482709', 'message': 'Set gw external net to empty for provider networks

Today the gateway_external_network_id is not set
when provider networks are configured. Both the
external_network_id and the gateway_external_network
should be set to empty strings for the provider network

commit_message:
Set gw external net to empty for multi-provider networks

Today the gateway_external_network_id variable is not
set when provider networks are configured. Both the
external_network_id and the gateway_external_network
should be set to empty strings for the provider network
to work with a single l3 agent for multiple external
networks.

Closes-Bug: #1410951

Change-Id: Iaf5547a6ff18818e05f97cdf9d24f2c70737568c

commit_message:
Add Configuration option to configure delete namespaces

With the introduction for distributed virtual routers
the existence of namespaces in the nodes have increased
tremendously and so the namespace should be cleaned up
whenever required.

So let us provide a configurable option to configure in
the local.conf to either enable or disable the
router_delete_namespaces option for neutron.

This patch introduces "Q_DEL_NAMESPACE" which will be
used to populate the "router_delete_namespaces".

Change-Id: Ie74156a802ca9c383364b65f8b68b4c8feaa1fea
Closes-Bug: #1413777
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/20/149420/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Delete namespaces or not Q_DEL_NAMESPACE=${Q_DEL_NAMESPACE:-True} iniset $NEUTRON_TEST_CONFIG_FILE DEFAULT router_delete_namespaces $Q_DEL_NAMESPACE iniset $Q_L3_CONF_FILE DEFAULT router_delete_namespaces $Q_DEL_NAMESPACE

commit_message:
Add coverage-package-name to tox.ini for coverage

Recent pbrs support a coverage-package-name argument which allows you to
explicitly specify the package name to test coverage of. By default it
takes the project name (python-openstacksdk) and splits the "python-"
prefix off, leaving it to check coverage of the nonexistent
"openstacksdk" package. After this, "tox -e cover html" works and drops
the results in a cover/ folder under root.

Change-Id: I55e3fb274158aa37938329f2153c5c9597e64915
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/04/135104/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = python setup.py testr --coverage --coverage-package-name=openstack --testr-args='{posargs}'

commit_message:
Enable trove plugin for trove tempest job

Trove will no longer be tested in the devstack updown job because
its configuration has moved from the devstack repo to the trove
repo, so remove the no-longer-necessary enable_trove flag in that
job.

Also remove the flag from the tempest job but replace it with the
configuration option to enable the plugin so that job does not
functionally change.

Change-Id: Iac738fb6071c8cb60961872cdef371582041d0a2
Depends-On: I8f9f1a015edb7ec1033e2eaf0b29ab15d89384ce

added_lines: export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin trove git://git.openstack.org/openstack/trove"

commit_message:
Create instance_extra entry if it doesn't update

When updating an instance, if there is no instance_extra, for older
instances, we make sure we create one if there is not one already.

This keeps flavor data migrations (ie system_metadata ->
instance_extra) from failing when the system_metadata entries are soft
deleted but an instance_extra entry is not created because it was
"updated" assuming an instance_extra entry already existed, leaving
the instance with no flavor data.

Closes-Bug: #1459758
Change-Id: I715217d98729c6c5ac45d64d8bacaaca745ff3d7
(cherry picked from commit e776d6fddf047ff5dc77420263bd60756ba6a988)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/05/186505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix xag param in read call from instance_disk_iter

Live testing revealed a bug in
nova_powervm.virt.powervm.disk.driver.DiskAdapter.instance_disk_iter
whereby Adapter.read's xag parameter was a single xag rather than a
list.  Fixed the bug and added UTs.

Change-Id: I9f0d78129fca97dacbea3bcbbdda25763850804e

commit_message:
(Un)map instance boot disk to Management Partition

In the disk drivers, provide the ability to map and unmap an instance's
boot disk to/from the management partition.

Change-Id: I992100da5618bb804da547e62308b83114819b0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/83/184583/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import oslo_log.log as logging from nova.i18n import _, _LWfrom nova_powervm.virt.powervm import diskLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class InstanceDiskMappingFailed(disk.AbstractDiskException): msg_fmt = _("Failed to map boot disk of instance %(instance_name)s to " "management partition %(mp_name)s from any Virtual I/O " "Server.") def connect_instance_disk_to_mgmt_partition(self, instance, mp_wrap): """Connect an instance's boot disk to the management partition. :param instance: The instance whose boot disk is to be mapped. :param mp_wrap: The LPAR EntryWrapper representing the management partition. :return stg_elem: The storage element (LU, VDisk, etc.) that was mapped :return vios: The EntryWrapper of the VIOS from which the mapping was made. :raise InstanceDiskMappingFailed: If the mapping could not be done. """ msg_args = {'instance_name': instance.name, 'mp_name': mp_wrap.name} for stg_elem, vios in self.instance_disk_iter(instance): msg_args['disk_name'] = stg_elem.name msg_args['vios_name'] = vios.name LOG.debug("Mapping boot disk %(disk_name)s of instance " "%(instance_name)s to management partition %(mp_name)s " "from Virtual I/O Server %(vios_name)s.", msg_args) try: tsk_map.add_vscsi_mapping(self.host_uuid, vios.uuid, mp_wrap.uuid, stg_elem) # If that worked, we're done. Let the caller know where the # mapping happened from. return stg_elem, vios except Exception as e: msg_args['exc'] = e LOG.warn(_LW("Failed to map boot disk %(disk_name)s of " "instance %(instance_name)s to management " "partition %(mp_name)s from Virtual I/O Server " "%(vios_name)s: %(exc)s"), msg_args) # Try the next hit, if available. # We either didn't find the boot dev, or failed all attempts to map it. raise InstanceDiskMappingFailed(**msg_args) def disconnect_disk_from_mgmt_partition(self, vios_uuid, mp_id, disk_name): """Disconnect a disk from the management partition. :param vios_uuid: The UUID of the Virtual I/O Server serving the mapping. :param mp_id: The integer short ID (not UUID) of the management partition. :param disk_name: The name of the disk to unmap. """ raise NotImplementedError()

commit_message:
Improve Endpoint Configurability

This change modifies the available endpoint configuration options to
allow for greater flexibility in configuring endpoint URIs. This is part
of a larger set of changes (outlined in 1274979), which seek to
normalize the endpoint options.

Change-Id: I5154974adc83df1f8799baa4c2863c1481ae74ea
Partial-Bug: 1274979

commit_message:
Improve Endpoint Configurability

This change modifies the available endpoint configuration options to
allow for greater flexibility in configuring endpoint URIs. This is part
of a larger set of changes (outlined in 1274979), which seek to
normalize the endpoint options.

Change-Id: I8039a092e4f74a454f0e80f0978b07c59226a479
Partial-Bug: 1274979

commit_message:
Fix condition in _publish_and_retry_on_missing_exchange()

The current condition logic in _publish_and_retry_on_missing_exchange()
replaces passed `timeout` value with `rpc_response_timeout` config value.

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I451cd2b5da78a3d7011466dfb14669aa1dcf1d5c

commit_message:
Standardize on assertJsonEqual in tests

Reuse what we have in the base test case and not add
custom json comparison routines.

Change-Id: I62aca157022c79dd692c23eea97a956c0df7e8bd

commit_message:
Spec for graduating reports

Spec for bp graduate-oslo-reports

Change-Id: Ic22523da92af6f5d73f10bf4a60e7a191ad509c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/15/185715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ==================== Graduating Reports ==================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/graduate-oslo-reports The `reports` module currently provides a convienient way to assemble "Guru Meditation Reports" about the current state a of a given OpenStack process. The basic report includes thread (both normal and green) state and stack traces, as well as configuration and version information. The reports are customizable and may be extended with additional sections on a per-process or per-project basis. A mechanism is also included to set up the reports to dump to stdout (or a file) on SIGUSR1, and may be serialized as text (default), as well as XML and JSON. Library Name ============ The library will be called "oslo.reports". The current name in the the incubator is "openstack.common.report", but pluralizing the name seems more natural. Contents ======== openstack/common/report/report.py openstack/common/report/utils.py openstack/common/report/guru_meditation_report.py openstack/common/report/__init__.py openstack/common/report/views/__init__.py openstack/common/report/views/text/__init__.py openstack/common/report/views/text/generic.py openstack/common/report/views/text/threading.py openstack/common/report/views/text/header.py openstack/common/report/views/xml/__init__.py openstack/common/report/views/xml/generic.py openstack/common/report/views/jinja_view.py openstack/common/report/views/json/__init__.py openstack/common/report/views/json/generic.py openstack/common/report/generators/conf.py openstack/common/report/generators/__init__.py openstack/common/report/generators/version.py openstack/common/report/generators/threading.py openstack/common/report/models/base.py openstack/common/report/models/conf.py openstack/common/report/models/__init__.py openstack/common/report/models/version.py openstack/common/report/models/with_default_views.py openstack/common/report/models/threading.py tests/unit/reports/test_base_report.py tests/unit/reports/test_guru_meditation_report.py tests/unit/reports/test_openstack_generators.py tests/unit/reports/test_views.py Early Adopters ============== None Public API ========== The `reports` module contains several public submodules: `reports.guru_meditation_report` Contains the code revolving around setting up the signal handler and registering persistent custom sections `reports.report` Contains the basic classes for the reports themselves, including a class for the whole report, a class for each section, and a subclass specifically for reports serialized as text `reports.generators` Contains the submodules containing generator code: `conf`, `threading`, `version` (not that there is no `base` module here since generators are just callables) `reports.models` Contains the submodules containing the base model classes (`base` and `with_default_views`) as well as the implementation model classes (`threading`, `version`, and `conf`) `report.views` Contains the submodule containing the basic Jinja-based view (`jinja_view`), as well as the JSON, XML, and text views (`json`, `xml`, and `text`, respectively). Note that each of the serialization-formatting submodules contains a `generic` submodule containing generic classes, and the `text` submodule additionally contains the `header` submodule (as well as the `threading` submodule, which may be made private). The following submodules do not necessarily need to be public: `reports.utils` Contains a utility class for attaching attributes to strings, as well as a function for finding all objects of a particular class using the garbage collector functionality. Neither of these need to be exposed as public, and the object-finding function can be moved into the file of the generator which uses it (`StringWithAttrs` is used by both `reports.views.xml.generic` and `reports.views.json.generic`), so it needs to stay in its own file. `reports.views.text.threading` This contains several views specific to certain models (which already have them set as the default text view), so it does not need to be public. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: sross-7 Other contributors: None Primary Maintainer ------------------ Primary Maintainer: sross-7 Other Contributors: None Security Contact ---------------- Security Contact: sross-7 Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Uknown Work Items ---------- The graduation checklist should be completed. Additionally, there are a few places where `reports` currently uses `str` and should be using `six.text_type` instead. These should be fixed before graduation is complete. Adoption Notes ============== None Dependencies ============ - oslo.utils - oslo.serialization References ========== None .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
network guide: add dhcp overview

Add an overview of the DHCP protocol

Change-Id: Ida8b8e0c4f859f184e2404aa781b0bb021499d90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/29/187029/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hosts connected to a network use the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) to dynamically obtain IP addresses. A DHCP server hands out the IP addresses to network hosts, which are the DHCP clients. DHCP clients locate the DHCP server by sending a UDP_ packet from port 68 to address ``255.255.255.255`` on port 67. Address ``255.255.255.255`` is the local network broadcast address: UDP packets sent to this address will be seen by all hosts on the local network. However, such packets will not be forwarded to other networks. Consequently, the DHCP server must be on the same local network as the client, or the server will not receive the broadcast. The DHCP server will respond by sending a UDP packet from port 67 to port 68 on the client. The exchange looks like this: 1. The client sends a discover ("Im a client at MAC address ``30:f7:0d:08:cf:e6``, I need an IP address") 2. The server sends an offer ("OK ``30:f7:0d:08:cf:e6``, Im offering IP address ``10.10.0.112``") 3. The client sends a request ("Server ``10.10.0.131``, I would like to have IP ``10.10.0.112``") 4. The server sends an acknowledgement ("OK ``30:f7:0d:08:cf:e6``, IP ``10.10.0.112`` is yours") OpenStack uses a third-party program called dnsmasq_ to implement the DHCP server. Dnsmasq writes to the syslog (/var/log/syslog), where you can observe the DHCP request and replies:: Apr 23 15:53:46 c100-1 dhcpd: DHCPDISCOVER from 30:f7:0d:08:cf:e6 via eth2 Apr 23 15:53:46 c100-1 dhcpd: DHCPOFFER on 10.10.0.112 to 30:f7:0d:08:cf:e6 via eth2 Apr 23 15:53:48 c100-1 dhcpd: DHCPREQUEST for 10.10.0.112 (10.10.0.131) from 30:f7:0d:08:cf:e6 via eth2 Apr 23 15:53:48 c100-1 dhcpd: DHCPACK on 10.10.0.112 to 30:f7:0d:08:cf:e6 via eth2 When troubleshooting an instance that is not reachable over the network, it can be helpful to examine this log to verify that all four steps of the DHCP protocol were carried out for the instance in question. .. _dnsmasq: http://www.thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/doc.html .. _UDP:

commit_message:
Compare each chunk of large objects when downloading

This allows the use of --skip-identical when downloading SLOs and DLOs,
while still only requiring one request for normal objects.

Change-Id: I237ec5a8cc4d1119b6d3f166db81a977a50a4e4e
Related-Bug: #1379252
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/12/172212/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _download_object_job(self, conn, container, obj, options): options['skip_identical'] = (options['skip_identical'] and out_file != '-') if options['skip_identical']: get_args = {'resp_chunk_size': 65536, 'headers': req_headers, 'response_dict': results_dict} if options['skip_identical']: # Assume the file is a large object; if we're wrong, the query # string is ignored and the If-None-Match header will trigger # the behavior we want get_args['query_string'] = 'multipart-manifest=get' try: headers, body = conn.get_object(container, obj, **get_args) except ClientException as e: if not options['skip_identical']: raise if e.http_status != 304: # Only handling Not Modified raise headers = results_dict['headers'] if 'x-object-manifest' in headers: # DLO: most likely it has more than one page worth of # segments and we have an empty file locally body = [] elif config_true_value(headers.get('x-static-large-object')): # SLO: apparently we have a copy of the manifest locally? # provide no chunking data to force a fresh download body = ['[]'] else: # Normal object: let it bubble up raise if options['skip_identical']: if config_true_value(headers.get('x-static-large-object')) or \ 'x-object-manifest' in headers: # The request was chunked, so stitch it back together chunk_data = self._get_chunk_data(conn, container, obj, headers, ''.join(body)) else: chunk_data = None if chunk_data is not None: if self._is_identical(chunk_data, filename): raise ClientException('Large object is identical', http_status=304) # Large objects are different; start the real download del get_args['query_string'] get_args['response_dict'].clear() headers, body = conn.get_object(container, obj, **get_args) def _get_chunk_data(self, conn, container, obj, headers, body=None): if body is None: _, body = conn.get_object( container, obj, query_string='multipart-manifest=get') for chunk in json.loads(body):
deleted_lines: @staticmethod def _download_object_job(conn, container, obj, options): if options['skip_identical'] and out_file != '-': headers, body = \ conn.get_object(container, obj, resp_chunk_size=65536, headers=req_headers, response_dict=results_dict) def _get_chunk_data(self, conn, container, obj, headers): _, manifest_data = conn.get_object( container, obj, query_string='multipart-manifest=get') for chunk in json.loads(manifest_data):

commit_message:
Split admin volumes tests to it's own test file

Currently volumes tests is in admin/volumes/tests.py, it
should have it's own test file like snapshots and volume_types.

Change-Id: Ic39397bff25626893b5a2c218837d2b3525f7526
Closes-Bug: #1459904
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/31/186631/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from django.core.urlresolvers import reverse from django import http from mox import IsA # noqa from openstack_dashboard.api import cinder from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.volumes.volumes import forms from openstack_dashboard.test import helpers as test class VolumeViewTests(test.BaseAdminViewTests): @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_reset_state', 'volume_get')}) def test_update_volume_status(self): volume = self.volumes.first() formData = {'status': 'error'} cinder.volume_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), volume.id).AndReturn(volume) cinder.volume_reset_state(IsA(http.HttpRequest), volume.id, formData['status']) self.mox.ReplayAll() res = self.client.post( reverse('horizon:admin:volumes:volumes:update_status', args=(volume.id,)), formData) self.assertNoFormErrors(res) @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_manage', 'volume_type_list', 'availability_zone_list', 'extension_supported')}) def test_manage_volume(self): metadata = {'key': u'k1', 'value': u'v1'} formData = {'host': 'host-1', 'identifier': 'vol-1', 'id_type': u'source-name', 'name': 'name-1', 'description': 'manage a volume', 'volume_type': 'vol_type_1', 'availability_zone': 'nova', 'metadata': metadata['key'] + '=' + metadata['value'], 'bootable': False} cinder.volume_type_list( IsA(http.HttpRequest)).\ AndReturn(self.volume_types.list()) cinder.availability_zone_list( IsA(http.HttpRequest)).\ AndReturn(self.availability_zones.list()) cinder.extension_supported( IsA(http.HttpRequest), 'AvailabilityZones').\ AndReturn(True) cinder.volume_manage( IsA(http.HttpRequest), host=formData['host'], identifier=formData['identifier'], id_type=formData['id_type'], name=formData['name'], description=formData['description'], volume_type=formData['volume_type'], availability_zone=formData['availability_zone'], metadata={metadata['key']: metadata['value']}, bootable=formData['bootable']) self.mox.ReplayAll() res = self.client.post( reverse('horizon:admin:volumes:volumes:manage'), formData) self.assertNoFormErrors(res) def test_manage_volume_extra_specs(self): # these should pass forms.validate_metadata("key1=val1") forms.validate_metadata("key1=val1,key2=val2") forms.validate_metadata("key1=val1,key2=val2,key3=val3") forms.validate_metadata("key1=") # these should throw a validation error self.assertRaises(forms.ValidationError, forms.validate_metadata, "key1==val1") self.assertRaises(forms.ValidationError, forms.validate_metadata, "key1=val1,") self.assertRaises(forms.ValidationError, forms.validate_metadata, "=val1") self.assertRaises(forms.ValidationError, forms.validate_metadata, ",") self.assertRaises(forms.ValidationError, forms.validate_metadata, " ") @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_unmanage', 'volume_get')}) def test_unmanage_volume(self): # important - need to get the v2 cinder volume which has host data volume_list = \ filter(lambda x: x.name == 'v2_volume', self.cinder_volumes.list()) volume = volume_list[0] formData = {'volume_name': volume.name, 'host_name': 'host@backend-name#pool', 'volume_id': volume.id} cinder.volume_get(IsA(http.HttpRequest), volume.id).AndReturn(volume) cinder.volume_unmanage(IsA(http.HttpRequest), volume.id).\ AndReturn(volume) self.mox.ReplayAll() res = self.client.post( reverse('horizon:admin:volumes:volumes:unmanage', args=(volume.id,)), formData) self.assertNoFormErrors(res)

commit_message:
Get unit tests working with Karma

Establish features for running Karma tests.  Separate karma configurations
are used due to current overlap of template file structure.

You can run the karma tests via:
  ./run_tests.sh --karma

The Karma framework allows for many features like unit test coverage and
provides a common configuration for different test runners.

Change-Id: I79680ef6369383c148da68e6677945886a48df81

commit_message:
Remove deprecated pxe_deploy_{kernel, ramdisk}

In the last cycle we have renamed some parameters to make it more
consistent across different drivers. This patch is removing the deprecated
pxe_deploy_{kernel, ramdisk} parameters from the code and updating the
documentation accordingly.

Depends-On: I3dcf8df130efc0c2ea35695018bedba31bf0570c
Change-Id: I07eb7ad28929b651cf04ef3955903e4f4ecf9900

commit_message:
Create bridges in ovsdb monitor functional tests

The test waits inside for output from 'ovsdb-client monitor Bridge'
command but the command makes output only if there is a bridge present
in ovsdb. This patch adds an OVSBridgeFixture to setup so every test
case has a bridge for sure.

Change-Id: I40e1c99ec956c92fa1c7763eb98f7f2ce6fcd226
Closes-Bug: 1447191
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/45/176345/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ovsdb-client monitor needs to have a bridge to make any output self.useFixture(net_helpers.OVSBridgeFixture())

commit_message:
Add updating jobs statuses before cluster deletion

We need to update statuses of jobs of current cluster before
deletion. This patch will allow to mark success in Sahara
already success jobs in Oozie.

Change-Id: If504a459e9d39031a7de0f20ea91124f6eed1253
Closes-bug: 1459226

commit_message:
Limit router gw ports' stateful fixed IPs to one per address family

Validate a router's gateway port during a router update by ensuring
it has no more than one v4 fixed IP and one v6 (statefully-assigned)
fixed IP.

Note that there is no limit on v6 addresses from SLAAC and
DHCPv6-stateless subnets as they are automatically allocated.

Change-Id: I6a328048b99af39ab9497fd9f265d1a9b95b7148
Closes-Bug: 1438819
Partially-implements: blueprint multiple-ipv6-prefixes
(cherry picked from commit 1bfd86e1ef7148370798aa99c868d7f931fcbf78)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/90/181690/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_router_update_gateway_upon_subnet_create_max_ips_ipv6(self): """Create subnet should not cause excess fixed IPs on router gw If a router gateway port has the maximum of one IPv4 and one IPv6 fixed, create subnet should not add any more IP addresses to the port (unless this is the subnet is a SLAAC/DHCPv6-stateless subnet in which case the addresses are added automatically) """ with self.router() as r, self.network() as n: with self.subnet(cidr='10.0.0.0/24', network=n) as s1, ( self.subnet(ip_version=6, cidr='2001:db8::/64', network=n)) as s2: self._set_net_external(n['network']['id']) self._add_external_gateway_to_router( r['router']['id'], n['network']['id'], ext_ips=[{'subnet_id': s1['subnet']['id']}, {'subnet_id': s2['subnet']['id']}], expected_code=exc.HTTPOk.code) res1 = self._show('routers', r['router']['id']) original_fips = (res1['router']['external_gateway_info'] ['external_fixed_ips']) # Add another IPv4 subnet - a fip SHOULD NOT be added # to the external gateway port as it already has a v4 address self._create_subnet(self.fmt, net_id=n['network']['id'], cidr='10.0.1.0/24') res2 = self._show('routers', r['router']['id']) self.assertEqual(original_fips, res2['router']['external_gateway_info'] ['external_fixed_ips']) # Add a SLAAC subnet - a fip from this subnet SHOULD be added # to the external gateway port s3 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, self._create_subnet(self.fmt, net_id=n['network']['id'], ip_version=6, cidr='2001:db8:1::/64', ipv6_ra_mode=l3_constants.IPV6_SLAAC, ipv6_address_mode=l3_constants.IPV6_SLAAC)) res3 = self._show('routers', r['router']['id']) fips = (res3['router']['external_gateway_info'] ['external_fixed_ips']) fip_subnet_ids = [fip['subnet_id'] for fip in fips] self.assertIn(s1['subnet']['id'], fip_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(s2['subnet']['id'], fip_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(s3['subnet']['id'], fip_subnet_ids) self._remove_external_gateway_from_router( r['router']['id'], n['network']['id']) def test_router_add_gateway_multiple_subnets_ipv6(self): """Ensure external gateway set doesn't add excess IPs on router gw Setting the gateway of a router to an external network with more than one IPv4 and one IPv6 subnet should only add an address from the first IPv4 subnet, an address from the first IPv6-stateful subnet, and an address from each IPv6-stateless (SLAAC and DHCPv6-stateless) subnet """ with self.router() as r, self.network() as n: with self.subnet( cidr='10.0.0.0/24', network=n) as s1, ( self.subnet( cidr='10.0.1.0/24', network=n)) as s2, ( self.subnet( cidr='2001:db8::/64', network=n, ip_version=6, ipv6_ra_mode=l3_constants.IPV6_SLAAC, ipv6_address_mode=l3_constants.IPV6_SLAAC)) as s3, ( self.subnet( cidr='2001:db8:1::/64', network=n, ip_version=6, ipv6_ra_mode=l3_constants.DHCPV6_STATEFUL, ipv6_address_mode=l3_constants.DHCPV6_STATEFUL)) as s4, ( self.subnet( cidr='2001:db8:2::/64', network=n, ip_version=6, ipv6_ra_mode=l3_constants.DHCPV6_STATELESS, ipv6_address_mode=l3_constants.DHCPV6_STATELESS)) as s5: self._set_net_external(n['network']['id']) self._add_external_gateway_to_router( r['router']['id'], n['network']['id']) res = self._show('routers', r['router']['id']) fips = (res['router']['external_gateway_info'] ['external_fixed_ips']) fip_subnet_ids = [fip['subnet_id'] for fip in fips] self.assertIn(s1['subnet']['id'], fip_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(s2['subnet']['id'], fip_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(s3['subnet']['id'], fip_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(s4['subnet']['id'], fip_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(s5['subnet']['id'], fip_subnet_ids) self._remove_external_gateway_from_router( r['router']['id'], n['network']['id'])

commit_message:
Use accessors instead of private attributes for Ml2 plugin

Start using accessors instead of private attributes of PortContext
and NetworkContext where it is possible.

Closes-bug: #1424587

Change-Id: Ie3d963ae6cee9782d65ba683936072602c78ebaa

commit_message:
Ensure metadata network works with DVR

As DVR routers use a different type of interface, this patch
amends the DHCP agent code ensuring that a metadata proxy is
spawned when the metadata network feature is enabled on the
DHCP agent.

(Cherry-picked from ec408ac379108eee26d87a8d9834180db11877e0)

Change-Id: Id7f2e891c0753620a604cf6160c6b592db1aa284
Closes-Bug: #1447344

commit_message:
Add handler flushing to roles that need it

This patch adds handler flushing as the last task in each role to ensure
that there are log files present when the rsyslog client configuration
task is executed a little later in the playbook that consumes the role.

Closes-Bug: #1458822
Change-Id: I92a26b620aa7bc0fbe33175594d37da7d5aca7df
(cherry picked from commit c7951c43e2f3bae01c595151af33d35dcf0b3ca4)
